title: F003: Implement webhook certificate management
description: Set up webhook TLS certificate provisioning — either via cert-manager integration or self-signed certificate generation. Configure the webhook server in the operator manager.

stories.title: Operator deploys with webhook certificates provisioned by cert-manager
stories.want: webhook TLS certificates to be automatically provisioned and rotated by cert-manager when deploying the operator
stories.so_that: I do not have to manually create or rotate webhook serving certificates and the operator webhooks are always reachable over TLS
criteria: A cert-manager Certificate resource is defined in config/certmanager/ that issues a TLS certificate for the webhook Service DNS name
A self-signed Issuer resource is defined in config/certmanager/ for the Certificate
The kustomization in config/default/ includes the cert-manager resources, CA injection patches, and webhook patches
caBundle fields in MutatingWebhookConfiguration and ValidatingWebhookConfiguration are annotated for cert-manager CA injection

stories.title: Operator webhook server listens on the correct port with TLS certificates
stories.want: the operator manager to serve webhooks on port 9443 with the TLS certificates provisioned by cert-manager
stories.so_that: the Kubernetes API server can reach the webhooks over HTTPS for admission review
criteria: The manager Deployment exposes containerPort 9443 named 'webhook-server'
The manager Deployment mounts a volume from the cert-manager-provisioned Secret at /tmp/k8s-webhook-server/serving-certs
The webhook.NewServer in cmd/main.go uses the default CertDir or explicitly sets it to /tmp/k8s-webhook-server/serving-certs
The webhook Service (config/webhook/service.yaml) routes port 443 to targetPort 9443

stories.title: Operator deploys without cert-manager using Kustomize overlay
stories.role: developer running locally or in envtest
stories.want: the default Kustomize overlay to support both cert-manager and non-cert-manager deployment modes
stories.so_that: I can test locally with envtest (which auto-generates certs) and deploy to production with cert-manager
criteria: The config/default/kustomization.yaml includes cert-manager resources and patches by default
All cert-manager patches are clearly documented with comments explaining their purpose
Envtest suite_test.go continues to work by using WebhookInstallOptions for local cert provisioning
A developer can comment out the cert-manager lines in config/default/kustomization.yaml to disable cert-manager

stories.title: Webhook configurations receive CA bundle injection from cert-manager
stories.want: cert-manager to automatically inject the CA bundle into the webhook configurations
stories.so_that: the Kubernetes API server trusts the webhook server's TLS certificate without manual caBundle management
criteria: MutatingWebhookConfiguration has annotation cert-manager.io/inject-ca-from pointing to the Certificate resource
ValidatingWebhookConfiguration has annotation cert-manager.io/inject-ca-from pointing to the Certificate resource
Kustomize patches in config/default/ add these annotations to the generated webhook configurations
The Certificate resource namespace/name matches the annotation values after Kustomize name/namespace transforms

stories.title: Webhook certificate configuration is documented with reference documentation
stories.want: clear reference documentation describing the webhook certificate management architecture
stories.so_that: I understand how certificates are provisioned, how cert-manager integration works, and what files to modify for customization
criteria: Reference doc exists at docs/reference/backend/webhook-certificate-management.md
Documentation covers the cert-manager Certificate and Issuer resources
Documentation covers the Kustomize patch mechanism for CA injection
Documentation covers the manager Deployment volume mount and webhook server configuration

requirements.description: The system SHALL provide a cert-manager Certificate resource that issues a TLS certificate for the webhook Service DNS name
requirements.rationale: Webhook admission requires TLS; cert-manager automates certificate lifecycle management (issuance, renewal, rotation)

scenarios.name: Certificate resource targets webhook service DNS
scenarios.when: the cert-manager Certificate resource is applied to the cluster
scenarios.then: it requests a certificate with dnsNames including the webhook Service's cluster DNS name
and_then: the certificate Secret is created in the operator namespace

scenarios.name: Certificate references self-signed Issuer
scenarios.then: it references the self-signed Issuer defined in the same namespace
and_then: cert-manager issues the certificate without external CA dependency

scenarios.name: Certificate Secret name matches volume mount
scenarios.then: the Secret name matches the volume source in the manager Deployment
and_then: the manager can mount the certificate files

requirements.description: The system SHALL provide a self-signed Issuer resource for the webhook Certificate
requirements.rationale: A self-signed Issuer provides zero-dependency certificate issuance suitable for webhook serving certificates

scenarios.name: Issuer is self-signed type
scenarios.when: the Issuer resource is applied to the cluster
scenarios.then: it is configured as a self-signed issuer (spec.selfSigned: {})
and_then: no external CA infrastructure is required

scenarios.name: Issuer is namespaced to operator namespace
scenarios.then: the Issuer ends up in the same namespace as the operator
and_then: the Certificate can reference it without cross-namespace issues

scenarios.name: Issuer name is referenced by Certificate
scenarios.when: the Certificate resource references the Issuer
scenarios.then: the issuerRef.name matches the Issuer resource name after Kustomize transforms
and_then: cert-manager can resolve the issuer and issue the certificate

requirements.description: The system SHALL configure Kustomize patches to inject cert-manager CA bundle annotations into webhook configurations
requirements.rationale: The API server needs to trust the webhook TLS certificate; cert-manager CA injector populates caBundle from annotations

scenarios.name: MutatingWebhookConfiguration receives CA injection annotation
scenarios.then: the MutatingWebhookConfiguration has annotation cert-manager.io/inject-ca-from set to CERTIFICATE_NAMESPACE/CERTIFICATE_NAME
and_then: cert-manager CA injector populates the caBundle field

scenarios.name: ValidatingWebhookConfiguration receives CA injection annotation
scenarios.then: the ValidatingWebhookConfiguration has the same CA injection annotation
and_then: both webhook configurations get CA bundles injected

scenarios.name: Annotation values use correct namespace/name after Kustomize transforms
scenarios.then: the annotation values resolve to the correct namespace/certificate-name
and_then: CA injection works despite Kustomize name mangling

requirements.description: The system SHALL configure the manager Deployment to mount webhook TLS certificates from the cert-manager Secret
requirements.rationale: The webhook server reads TLS certs from disk; the Deployment must mount the cert-manager Secret as a volume

scenarios.name: Deployment has cert volume and mount
scenarios.when: the Kustomize build produces the manager Deployment
scenarios.then: the Deployment has a volume 'cert' from Secret 'webhook-server-cert' mounted at /tmp/k8s-webhook-server/serving-certs
and_then: the webhook server finds tls.crt and tls.key at the expected paths

scenarios.name: Webhook server port is exposed
scenarios.then: containerPort 9443 named 'webhook-server' is exposed on the manager container
and_then: the webhook Service can route to the correct port

scenarios.name: Volume is read-only
scenarios.then: readOnly is set to true on the volume mount
and_then: the container cannot modify the certificate files

requirements.description: The system SHALL wire cert-manager, webhook patches, and volume mounts into config/default/kustomization.yaml
requirements.rationale: The default Kustomize overlay must produce a fully functional deployment with cert-manager-managed webhook certificates

scenarios.name: Kustomize build succeeds
scenarios.then: the build completes without errors
and_then: all patches, resources, and replacements resolve correctly

scenarios.name: Output includes cert-manager resources
scenarios.then: the output YAML includes Issuer and Certificate resources
and_then: deploying the output installs cert-manager resources

scenarios.name: Output includes annotated webhook configurations
scenarios.then: both MutatingWebhookConfiguration and ValidatingWebhookConfiguration have CA injection annotations
and_then: cert-manager will inject CA bundles at runtime

requirements.description: The system SHALL ensure the webhook Service correctly routes to the webhook server port
requirements.rationale: The Service is the network endpoint the API server uses to reach webhooks

scenarios.name: Service port 443 maps to targetPort 9443
scenarios.then: port 443 routes to targetPort 9443
and_then: the API server reaches the webhook server

scenarios.name: Service selector matches manager pods
scenarios.then: its selector matches the manager Deployment pod labels
and_then: traffic reaches the correct pods

scenarios.name: Service is in the operator namespace
scenarios.then: the Service is in memcached-operator-system
and_then: webhook clientConfig.service references resolve

requirements.description: The system SHOULD ensure existing envtest integration tests continue to pass
requirements.rationale: Envtest provides its own certificate management; production cert changes must not break tests

scenarios.name: Envtest uses WebhookInstallOptions for certs
scenarios.then: it provisions local certificates via WebhookInstallOptions
and_then: no dependency on cert-manager in tests

scenarios.name: All existing tests pass
scenarios.then: all webhook integration tests pass without modification
and_then: no regressions from Kustomize changes

scenarios.name: Cert-manager patches only apply to config/default/
scenarios.then: the webhook manifests are unmodified (no cert-manager annotations in base)
and_then: envtest reads clean manifests

requirements.description: The system SHALL provide reference documentation for the webhook certificate management architecture
requirements.rationale: Operators need to understand the certificate provisioning chain and how to customize it

scenarios.name: Doc covers cert-manager resources
scenarios.when: a developer reads the reference doc
scenarios.then: they find documentation of the Issuer, Certificate, and CA injection resources
and_then: they understand the provisioning chain

scenarios.name: Doc covers Kustomize overlay structure
scenarios.when: a developer reads the reference doc
scenarios.then: they find documentation of all patches and replacements in config/default/
and_then: they can customize the deployment

scenarios.name: Doc covers runtime certificate flow
scenarios.when: a developer reads the reference doc
scenarios.then: they find documentation of volume mount, CertDir, and how the webhook server loads certs
and_then: they understand the runtime behavior

tasks.title: Create cert-manager Issuer and Certificate resources in config/certmanager/ (REQ-001, REQ-002)
tasks.description: Create config/certmanager/certificate.yaml containing: (1) a self-signed Issuer named 'selfsigned-issuer' with spec.selfSigned: {}, and (2) a Certificate named 'serving-cert' referencing the Issuer, with secretName 'webhook-server-cert', dnsNames for the webhook Service (SERVICE_NAME.SERVICE_NAMESPACE.svc, SERVICE_NAME.SERVICE_NAMESPACE.svc.cluster.local). Create config/certmanager/kustomization.yaml listing certificate.yaml as a resource. Follow standard Kubebuilder cert-manager layout.

tasks.title: Create CA injection Kustomize patches for webhook configurations (REQ-003)
tasks.description: Create config/default/webhookcainjection_patch.yaml containing two patch documents: (1) a patch for MutatingWebhookConfiguration 'mutating-webhook-configuration' adding annotation cert-manager.io/inject-ca-from: CERTIFICATE_NAMESPACE/CERTIFICATE_NAME, and (2) same for ValidatingWebhookConfiguration 'validating-webhook-configuration'. Use Kustomize-friendly metadata so these patches work with the default overlay.

tasks.title: Create manager Deployment patch for webhook volume mount and port (REQ-004)
tasks.description: Create config/default/manager_webhook_patch.yaml as a strategic merge patch for the manager Deployment that adds: (1) a volume 'cert' sourced from Secret 'webhook-server-cert' with defaultMode 420, (2) a volumeMount on the manager container at /tmp/k8s-webhook-server/serving-certs with readOnly: true, (3) containerPort 9443 named 'webhook-server'. This follows the standard Kubebuilder pattern for webhook cert volume mounts.

tasks.title: Update config/default/kustomization.yaml to wire cert-manager resources, patches, and replacements (REQ-005)
tasks.description: Update config/default/kustomization.yaml to: (1) add ../certmanager to resources, (2) add manager_webhook_patch.yaml and webhookcainjection_patch.yaml to patches, (3) add Kustomize replacements (using the replacements field) to substitute CERTIFICATE_NAMESPACE and CERTIFICATE_NAME in the CA injection annotations with the actual cert-manager Certificate's namespace and name. Ensure namePrefix and namespace transformations propagate correctly. Verify the kustomize build succeeds.

tasks.title: Add Kustomize build validation test for config/default/ (REQ-005)
tasks.description: Write a Go test (or shell-based make target) that runs 'kustomize build config/default/' and verifies: (1) the build succeeds without errors, (2) output contains Issuer and Certificate resources, (3) output contains MutatingWebhookConfiguration with cert-manager.io/inject-ca-from annotation, (4) output contains ValidatingWebhookConfiguration with cert-manager.io/inject-ca-from annotation, (5) manager Deployment has webhook-server port and cert volume mount. This can be a table-driven Go test that parses the kustomize output YAML.

tasks.title: Write reference documentation for webhook certificate management (REQ-008)
tasks.description: Create docs/reference/backend/webhook-certificate-management.md documenting: (1) Overview of the cert-manager integration architecture, (2) File listing of config/certmanager/ resources (Issuer, Certificate) with field descriptions, (3) Kustomize patches in config/default/ (CA injection annotations, volume mount, port), (4) How cert-manager CA injector populates caBundle at runtime, (5) Manager Deployment webhook server configuration (CertDir, port 9443), (6) How envtest handles certificates differently, (7) How to customize (use different Issuer, external CA, etc.). Follow the style of existing docs like docs/reference/backend/defaulting-webhook.md.

test_specifications.story: Operator deploys with webhook certificates provisioned by cert-manager
test_specifications.expected: Kustomize build of config/default/ should include Issuer and Certificate resources in the output YAML

test_specifications.story: Operator deploys with webhook certificates provisioned by cert-manager
test_specifications.expected: The Issuer resource in the kustomize output should have spec.selfSigned: {} and be in the operator namespace

test_specifications.story: Webhook configurations receive CA bundle injection from cert-manager
test_specifications.expected: Both MutatingWebhookConfiguration and ValidatingWebhookConfiguration should have cert-manager.io/inject-ca-from annotation pointing to the correct Certificate

test_specifications.story: Operator webhook server listens on the correct port with TLS certificates
test_specifications.expected: Manager Deployment should have volume 'cert' from Secret 'webhook-server-cert', volumeMount at /tmp/k8s-webhook-server/serving-certs, and containerPort 9443

test_specifications.story: Operator deploys without cert-manager using Kustomize overlay
test_specifications.expected: Running kustomize build config/default/ should complete without errors

test_specifications.story: Operator webhook server listens on the correct port with TLS certificates
test_specifications.expected: Webhook Service should map port 443 to targetPort 9443 and have selector matching manager pods

test_specifications.story: Operator deploys without cert-manager using Kustomize overlay
test_specifications.expected: All existing webhook defaulting integration tests should continue to pass after cert-manager Kustomize changes

test_specifications.story: Operator deploys without cert-manager using Kustomize overlay
test_specifications.expected: All existing webhook validation integration tests should continue to pass after cert-manager Kustomize changes

review_criteria: Kustomize build of config/default/ succeeds without errors and produces valid YAML
Output YAML includes self-signed Issuer and Certificate resources with correct DNS names and secret name
Both MutatingWebhookConfiguration and ValidatingWebhookConfiguration have cert-manager.io/inject-ca-from annotation with correctly resolved namespace/name
Manager Deployment has webhook-server containerPort 9443, cert volume from Secret, and volume mount at /tmp/k8s-webhook-server/serving-certs
All existing tests pass (make test) — no regressions in envtest webhook tests
Kustomize build test validates the complete deployment manifest structure
config/webhook/ base manifests remain unmodified (cert-manager annotations only in config/default/ patches)
Reference documentation covers cert-manager resources, Kustomize patches, runtime behavior, and customization
All YAML follows Kubebuilder/Kustomize conventions (apiVersion, kind, metadata structure)
Go vet passes, golangci-lint passes, no type errors in test files
implementation_notes:
This feature follows the standard Kubebuilder pattern for webhook certificate management with cert-manager. The architecture has three layers:

1. **Base webhook manifests** (config/webhook/): Contains the generated MutatingWebhookConfiguration and ValidatingWebhookConfiguration manifests (already exist) and the webhook Service (already exists). These are NOT modified — they remain clean for envtest.

2. **Cert-manager resources** (config/certmanager/): New directory containing a self-signed Issuer and a Certificate that provisions a TLS cert for the webhook Service DNS name. The Certificate's secretName (webhook-server-cert) is what the manager Deployment mounts.

3. **Default overlay patches** (config/default/): Patches that wire everything together — CA injection annotations on webhook configs, volume mount on the manager Deployment, and Kustomize replacements to substitute the correct namespace/name values.

The webhook server in cmd/main.go already creates a webhook.NewServer with TLS options. Controller-runtime's default CertDir is /tmp/k8s-webhook-server/serving-certs, and the default port is 9443. No changes to Go code are needed — this is purely a Kustomize/manifest change.

Key files to reference:
- cmd/main.go:63 — webhook server creation (already exists, no changes needed)
- config/webhook/service.yaml — webhook Service (already maps 443→9443)
- config/webhook/manifests.yaml — generated webhook configurations (already exist)
- config/default/kustomization.yaml — main overlay to update
- internal/controller/suite_test.go — envtest setup (uses WebhookInstallOptions, not affected)

Risks:
- Kustomize replacement syntax must exactly match the annotation placeholder values; a mismatch causes silent failures where CA injection does not work
- The namePrefix 'memcached-operator-' must be accounted for in cert-manager resource names and DNS names
- If cert-manager is not installed on the target cluster, the deployment will create Certificate/Issuer resources that remain pending — this is expected and documented

The envtest suite reads webhook manifests from config/webhook/ (not config/default/), so cert-manager patches in config/default/ do not affect test execution.
